Russian #WildFire smoke reaches North Pole

Wildfire smoke has travelled more than 3,000 km from #Yakutia to reach the North Pole, which is the first time in recorded history.
The #smoke stretches about 2,000 miles from east to west and 2,500 miles from south to north. https://t.co/trk5S3XJ9w
#Wildfire response tip: Wait for the “all clear” and check with fire officials before attempting to re-enter your home. Click here for more tips: https://t.co/Czj2Z6YRi6 https://t.co/AdnDwiuoR7

Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis apologized for failing in tackling the catastrophic #wildfire in #Greece.
More than 500 wildfires have been burning across the country, 1000s have been evacuated
"Cimate crisis is knocking on the door of the entire planet," saidMitsotakis

A number of points within the #Komodo National Park Area have burned since last week. Fires on the savannas were triggered by the current hot and dry weather. Although the fire became larger, it did not disturb the natural habitat of the Komodo dragons. #SEAToday #Wildfire https://t.co/epzsTobsiH

California's Dixie Fire is now the largest single-source wildfire in state history. The blaze expanded to nearly 500,000 acres late Sunday, about the size of Cancun, Mexico, and larger than the city of Houston, Texas. #DixieFire #CAwx #wildfire https://t.co/tdFNZxkzi1
